page.title: 15Johnson and Nephew Ltd.
page.content: Johnson and Nephew is a wire manufacturer in Ambergate.It was built in 1876.The person who owned it was Richard Johnson. When he retired his nephew took over,thats how it got its name. There are three diffrent types of wire. The welding wire is used for bridges ,and cars, the thick wire is used for thick strong bridges and the normal wire is used for bed springs, spokes and hair grips.The factory employs 401 people. The River Derwent runs under the factory and was used to drive the turbines,but now larger electricity generators are used.There was a new weir in 1948 after a fire destroyed the factory roofs.The biggest coils of wire weigh 2.25 tons.The smallest coils are 50 kilos.Altogether,there is 50,260,000 tons sold a year.
